nodes.bodyText: nit: I like parenthesis when args are present

What do you think about keeping this file in the private workbench-devops repo? If someone else wants to use this code, we wouldn't want them to use our institution file most likely. I.e., there are only nefarious reasons for them doing that, and no good ones.
nit: there might be a simpler syntax for defining a "switch" or boolean parameter. Maybe not if it's default true though.

nodes.bodyText: nit: why a trailing newline? I don't see that in the first half dozen or so descriptions in this file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1285,6 +1285,60 @@ def export_workspace_data(cmd_name, *args)
     :fn => ->(*args) {export_workspace_data("export-workspace-data", *args)}
 })
 
+def load_institutions(cmd_name, *args)
+  common = Common.new
+  ensure_docker cmd_name, args
+
+  op = WbOptionsParser.new(cmd_name, args)
+  op.opts.dry_run = true
+  op.opts.project = TEST_PROJECT
+
+  op.add_typed_option(
+      "--dry_run=[dry_run]",
+      TrueClass,
+      ->(opts, v) { opts.dry_run = v},
+      "When true, print debug lines instead of performing writes. Defaults to true.")
+
+  op.add_typed_option(
+      "--import-filename [import-filename]",
+      String,
+      ->(opts, v) { opts.importFilename = v},
+      "File (JSON) containing list of institutions to save")
+
+  # Create a cloud context and apply the DB connection variables to the environment.
+  # These will be read by Gradle and passed as Spring Boot properties to the command-line.
+  gcc = GcloudContextV2.new(op)
+  op.parse.validate
+  gcc.validate()
+
+  if op.opts.dry_run
+    common.status "DRY RUN -- CHANGES WILL NOT BE PERSISTED"
+  end
+
+  flags = ([
+      ["--import-filename", op.opts.importFilename]
+  ]).map { |kv| "#{kv[0]}=#{kv[1]}" }
+  if op.opts.dry_run
+    flags += ["--dry-run"]
+  end
+  # Gradle args need to be single-quote wrapped.
+  flags.map! { |f| "'#{f}'" }
+
+  with_cloud_proxy_and_db(gcc) do
+    common.run_inline %W{
+        gradle loadInstitutions
+       -PappArgs=[#{flags.join(',')}]}
+  end
+end
+
+LOAD_INSTITUTIONS_CMD = "load-institutions"
+
+Common.register_command({
+    :invocation => LOAD_INSTITUTIONS_CMD,
+    :description => "Load institutions specified in given file.\n",

nodes.bodyText: It can be helpful to have an example file and refer to it from here, e.g. "see /path/to/examples/institutions.json". These would need to be fake/anonymous.
thinking out loud, but I wonder if it wouldn't be easier for the Ruby layer to build a JSON object of the options and just pass them to Java as one chunk. No need to change this now though.
Hmm, that would make the gradle commands pretty unwieldy if they're used without project.rb.
nit: with builders, I like to see them instantiated inline unless we've got conditionals happening or they're more than a couple of levels deep. I'd inline your two option vars into this declaration.
do you want to check if props have changed here? Even if you don't want to upsert, it's good to know.
File naming nit: for other configs we have {configType}_{env}.json. Prefer that convension here, e.g. institutions_test.json
